pullRequest.body:
We define the notion of a submersive presentation and predicates when such a presentation is standard smooth. An algebra is called standard smooth if it admits a standard smooth presentation.

This contribution was created as part of the AIM workshop "Formalizing algebraic geometry" in June 2024.

Co-authored-by: Andrew Yang @erdOne
Co-authored-by: Jung Tao Cheng @rontaucheng  

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

This only contains definitions. Follow-up PRs are in the pipeline to resolve the first three TODOs in the module docstring.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [77238e4e1c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14325/commits/77238e4e1c3cc92bd67678507dc1e25628236d27)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.Smooth.StandardSmooth`|1192|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsStandardSmooth.relativeDimension`
`+ PreSubmersivePresentation`
`+ SubmersivePresentation`
`+ card_relations_le_card_vars_of_isFinite`
`+ differential`
`+ jacobiMatrix`
`+ jacobiMatrix_apply`
`+ jacobian`
`+ jacobian_eq_jacobiMatrix_det`
`++ IsStandardSmooth`
`++ IsStandardSmoothOfRelativeDimension`
`++ IsStandardSmoothOfRelativeDimension.isStandardSmooth`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

My only concern with this PR is that the name `SubmersivePresentation` already contains the word `submersive`, even though the data and assumptions are only introduced in order to be able to define the jacobian. "Submersion" basically means "smooth" already.

I would suggest renaming `SubmersivePresentation` as `PreSubmersivePresentation`, and have `SubmersivePresentation` extend `PreSubmersivePresentation` which the two extrafields `jacobian_isUnit` and `isFinite`.

> My only concern with this PR is that the name `SubmersivePresentation` already contains the word `submersive`, even though the data and assumptions are only introduced in order to be able to define the jacobian. "Submersion" basically means "smooth" already.
> 
> I would suggest renaming `SubmersivePresentation` as `PreSubmersivePresentation`, and have `SubmersivePresentation` extend `PreSubmersivePresentation` which the two extrafields `jacobian_isUnit` and `isFinite`.

And then remove the `IsStandardSmooth` typeclass for `PreSubmersivePresentation`s? Or have both `IsStandardSmooth` and `SubmersivePresentation`?

> And then remove the `IsStandardSmooth` typeclass for `PreSubmersivePresentation`s?

Yes, and then, `IsStandardSmooth` would only be a `RingHom` property, which would assert the existence of a `SubmersivePresentation`.
Thanks for the suggestions @joelriou and @MichaelStollBayreuth. I adapted them in the latest commit.
Anything else I should address here?

:v: chrisflav can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks for all the reviews!

bors r+
This PR was included in a batch that was canceled, it will be automatically retried

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9946522136/job/27477236538)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9946522136/job/27477236902)
bors d+
bors d+

```suggestion
that has fewer relations than generators. More precisely there exists
```
("less" for uncountable, "fewer" for countable stuff)
Does `doc-gen` realize that these names should be prefixed by `Algebra.`? If not, add the prefix so that the linking works.
I have done it like this before and the linking worked.
Is this `P.map`? (And there is an inconsistency between `P.rels` and `P.relations` here and below.)
Yes, it's `P.map`, I have made it explicit.
What is the content of this field when no `Fintype` instance for `P.rels` is provided?
OK, I realize that this is not a field of the structure. Maybe clarify what is part of the structure and what are additional declarations?
Is it clearer now?

Is this a `Prop`?
```suggestion
- `SubmersivePresentation.IsStandardSmooth`: `P` is standard smooth if its jacobian
```
(it's = it is)

```suggestion
  every standard smooth has dimension `n` (TODO, see below).
```

```suggestion
- `IsStandardSmooth`: A ring homomorphism `R +* S` is standard smooth if `S` is standard smooth as
```
("hom" is a bit colloquial. Beware of the long line linter!)
... the module of ... is ... ? (A Khler differential cannot be `S`-free itself)

```suggestion
Standard smooth algebras and ring homomorphisms feature 4 universe levels: The universe levels of the rings
```

```suggestion
The `j`-th standard basis vector, corresponding to the `j`-th relation of `P`, is mapped
```

```suggestion
/-- A ring homomorphism `R +* S` is standard smooth if `S` is standard smooth as `S`-algebra. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- A ring homomorphism `R +* S` is standard smooth of relative dimension `n` if
```

Here, I would rather say that there exists a submersive presentation that is of relative dimension `n`. Otherwise, you will have issues when proving that that if `f` is std smooth of relative dimension `a` and `g` of rel. dim.`b`, then `IsStandardSmooth (g.comp f) (a + b)`. The (silly) reason is that over the zero ring, the uniqueness of the rel. dim. is not true. The uniqueness shall hold only under the `Nontrivial S` assumption.

Ah, good catch. This was how I originally had set things up. I changed it, because `IsStandardSmooth R S` can't be inferred from `IsStandardSmoothOfRelativeDimension n R S`, so things get slightly annoying. But I did not check carefully enough that the mathematical meaning does not change. I now changed it back.
I am pretty sure that doc-gen can't figure out whether this is the algebra or the ringhom version. So I think it still pays of to be explicit about the namespace when there is ambiguity.

Did you mean
```suggestion
of `P.differential` viewed as element of `S`. -/
```

So that we can use dot-notation:
```suggestion
lemma IsStandardSmoothOfRelativeDimension.isStandardSmooth (f : R +* S)
```
Please include (here or in the TODO, or both) a discussion of how this notion relates to the "other" definition of smooth.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/Smooth): define standard smooth algebras
